doc.str: High molecular weight polymers containing pendant salicylic acid groups for clarifying Bayer process liquors

A high molecular weight, water-soluble polymer comprising pendant salicylic acid groups and having a weight average molecular weight of at least about 2,000,000 daltons and use of the polymer for clarifying red mud-containing liquors generated in the Bayer process for the recovery of alumina from bauxite.

Bonaccorsi et al., "Coordination Chemical Concepts Applied to the Design of Metal Ion Crosslinked Polymer Gels", Intern. J. Polymeric Mater., vol. 18, pp. 165-177 (1992). cited by other | Braun et al., "Reversible Cross-Linking by Complex Formation. Polymers Containing 2-Hydroxybenzoic Acid Residues", European Polymer Journal, vol. 12, pp. 525-528 (1976). cited by other | Kennedy et al., "Poly-(4- and 5-acrylamidosalicylic Acids). Part I. Preparation and Properties", J.C.S. Perkin I, 488-490 (1973). cited by other | Elvira et al., "Synthesis and Stereochemistry of Isomeric Methacrylic Polymers Derived From 4- and 5-Aminosalicylic Acids", Polymer, vol. 38(18), 4743-4750 (1997). cited by other | DeGeiso et al., "Polymeric Ligands. I. Some Salicylic Acid Derivatives", J. Org. Chem., vol. 27, pp. 1424-1426 (1962). cited by other.
